Flask has changed over the years, currently you need your code like this :  from wtforms import StringField, PasswordField, SubmitField, BooleanField, EmailField, validators  class RegistrationForm(FlaskForm):     username = StringField("Username", [validators.DataRequired(), validators.Length(min=2, max=15)])     email = EmailField("Email", [validators.DataRequired(), validators.Email()])      password = PasswordField("Password", [validators.DataRequired(),                                           validators.EqualTo("confirm_password", message="Passwords must match")])     confirm_password = PasswordField('Repeat Password')     submit = SubmitField("Sign Up")  1) you dont need this line " from wtforms.validators import DataRequired, Length, Email, EqualTo " anymore 2) Flask is doing all the validation currently from validators"dot"something for example validators.DataRequired()... validators.Email()... 3) so after field you put the name, and after comma you do validation like validators.DataRequired() 4) for Email validation, that means that if you write just "ASD" into email field and try to send it, it should tell you immediatelly that it's incorrect format of email. For this you need to use EmailField not StringField 5) with this code, there is password validation, that they match, only with this code above there is currently no alerts for that so dont be afraid, that there is no validation.
